tit.cmt: Incident 大文字にしました。

sen.j: 天誅組の変（てんちゅうぐみのへん）は、幕末の文久3年（1863年）8月17日 (旧暦)に吉村寅太郎をはじめとする尊皇攘夷派浪人の一団（天誅組）が公卿中山忠光を主将として大和国で決起し、後に江戸幕府軍の討伐を受けて壊滅した事件である。
sen.e: Tenchu-gumi incident occurred at the end of the Edo period; it was carried out by a group of people called Tenchi-gumi (Heavenly Avenging Force) consisting of a bunch of ronin (masterless samurai) who were Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) including Torture YOSHIMURA; this group rose to action in Yamato Province having a Court noble Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA as the commander-in-chief in on August 17 (Lunar calendar), 1863 and subsequently subjugated by the Edo bakufu army (the army of Japanese feudal government headed by the shogun) and the group was destroyed.

Tenchu-gumi Incident ("Tenchu-gumi no hen" in Japanese) was an incident that occurred at the end of the Edo period; it was carried out by a group of people called Tenchu-gumi (Heavenly Avenging Force) consisting of a bunch of ronin (masterless samurai) who were Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) including Torataro YOSHIMURA; this group rose to action in Yamato Province having a court noble Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA as the commander-in-chief on September 29, 1863 and was subsequently put down and destroyed by the army of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by the shogun).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。人名のスペルを修正しました。後半の表現を一部変更しました。後の文章に、大和義挙、大和の乱という別称について触れられているため、ここでも「てんちゅうぐみのへん」という読みを追加しました。
sen.e: Tenchu-gumi Incident ("Tenchu-gumi no hen" in Japanese) was an incident that occurred at the end of the Edo period; it was carried out by a group of people called Tenchu-gumi (Heavenly Avenging Force) consisting of a bunch of ronin (masterless samurai) who were Sonno Joi ha (supporters of the doctrine of restoring the emperor and expelling the barbarians) including Torataro YOSHIMURA; this group rose to action in Yamato Province having a court noble Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA as the commander-in-chief on September 29, 1863 and was subsequently put down and destroyed by the army of the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by the shogun).

sen.j: 尊皇攘夷派による、初めての武力蜂起とされる。

sen.j: 文久2年（1862年）12月、孝明天皇は攘夷の勅書を征夷大将軍徳川家茂に授けた。
sen.e: Emperor Komei gave an Imperial letter concerning the exclusion of foreigners to Seii-Taishogun (literally "great general who subdues the barbarians") Iemochi TOKUNAGA in December of 1862.
Emperor Komei gave an Imperial letter concerning the exclusion of foreigners to seii taishogun (literally "great general who subdues the barbarians") Iemochi TOKUGAWA in January, 1863.

sen.j: これに対して家茂は明年3月に攘夷を決行する旨を奉答する。
sen.e: To this Imperial letter, Iemochi responded as that he will carry out exclusion of foreigners next year.
To this Imperial letter, Iemochi responded that he would carry out exclusion of foreigners in April of 1863.

sen.e: Emperor Komei visited Kamo-jinja Shrine and Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine to pray for the exclusion of foreigners.
Emperor Komei visited Kamo-jinja Shrine and Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine to pray for the exclusion of foreigners.

sen.e: The Imperial Court pressed the Shogunate insistently for decisive action to exclude foreigners that the Shogunate was obliged to answer as to carry out the policy on May 10.

sen.j: 5月10日、幕府が攘夷を実行に移すことはなかったが、長州藩はこれを信じて下関海峡を通過するアメリカ合衆国船を砲撃して遂に攘夷を決行してしまった（下関戦争）。
sen.e: On May 10, the Shogunate did not put the policy of expulsion of foreigners into practice; however, Choshu Domain believed in the words of Shogunate and the clan itself put the policy of expulsion of foreigners by firing on the ships from the United States that were passing the Straits of Shimonoseki (the Shimonoseki War).

On June 25, the bakufu never carried out any action; however, Choshu Domain believed in the words of bakufu and they themselves started expelling foreigners by firing on the ships of the United States that were passing the Straits of Shimonoseki (the Shimonoseki War).
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: この外国船打ち払いには、過激な攘夷派公卿の侍従中山忠光が長州藩に招かれて加わっていた。
sen.e: Chamberlain Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA was one of the members who participated in this gunfire on the foreign ship; he was a radical Court noble who firmly believed in expulsion of foreigners and was invited by Choshu Domain to this gunfire.

sen.e: Bombarding a French ship as well as a Dutch ship, Choshu Domain greatly raised morale of Joi ha and the Imperial Court gave Choshu Domain words of praise for the decisive action the Domain took.
Bombarding a French ship as well as a Dutch ship, Choshu Domain greatly raised morale of Joi ha and the Imperial Court gave Choshu Domain words of praise for the decisive action the Domain took.

sen.e: The soldiers of various Domains began to move; on 6th the soldiers of Kishu Domain arrived at Fuki Village; Tenchu-gumi set a private house on fire to disturb.
The soldiers of various domains began to move; on October 18, the soldiers of Kishu Domain arrived at Fuki Village, upon which Tenchu-gumi set a private house on fire to disturb.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: The soldiers of various domains began to move; on October 18, the soldiers of Kishu Domain arrived at Fuki Village, upon which Tenchu-gumi set a private house on fire to disturb.

sen.j: 7日、天誅組先鋒が大日川で津藩兵と交戦して、これを五条へ退ける。
sen.e: On 7th, the vanguard of Tenchu-gumi was at war with the soldiers of Tsu Domain in Obikawa and Tenchu-gumi succeeded in letting the soldiers of Tsu Domain to retreat to Gojo.
On October 19, the vanguard of Tenchu-gumi was at war with the soldiers of Tsu Domain in Obikawa and it succeeded in making the soldiers of Tsu Domain retreat to Gojo.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On October 19, the vanguard of Tenchu-gumi was at war with the soldiers of Tsu Domain in Obikawa and it succeeded in making the soldiers of Tsu Domain retreat to Gojo.

sen.j: 天誅組は軍議を開き大坂方面へ脱出することを策す。
sen.e: Tenchu-gumi opened a council of war; and contrived to escape to Osaka area.
Tenchu-gumi opened a council of war and contrived to escape to Osaka area.
sen.cmt: セミコロンを削除しました。
sen.e: Tenchu-gumi opened a council of war and contrived to escape to Osaka area.

sen.j: 8日、幕府軍は総攻撃を10日と定めて攻囲軍諸藩に命じた。
sen.e: On 8th the Shogunate force decided to do an all-out attack on 10th and ordered various Domains who are in charge of attacking Tenchu-gumi to do an all-out attack on 10th.
On October 20, the bakufu army decided to do an all-out attack on October 22 and ordered various domains in charge of besieging Tenchu-gumi to that effect.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On October 20, the bakufu army decided to do an all-out attack on October 22 and ordered various domains in charge of besieging Tenchu-gumi to that effect.

sen.j: 総兵力14000人に及ぶ諸藩兵は各方面から進軍、天誅組は善戦するものの、主将の中山忠光の命令が混乱して一貫せず兵たちは右往左往を余儀なくされ、忠光は人望をすっかり失ってしまった。
sen.e: The military power of various Domains reached 14,000 in total; soldiers from various Domains marched on from every direct; Tenchu-gumi fought well; however, because the orders of the commander-in-chief Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA were confusing and incoherent and the soldiers did not know what to do; consequently Tadamitsu has lost popularity entirely.

The soldiers of various domains, reaching as many as 14,000 in total, marched on from every direct; Tenchu-gumi fought well, however, because the orders of the commander-in-chief Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA were confusing and incoherent, soldiers became panic-stricken and Tadamitsu completely lost popularity.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。
sen.e: The soldiers of various domains, reaching as many as 14,000 in total, marched on from every direct; Tenchu-gumi fought well, however, because the orders of the commander-in-chief Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA were confusing and incoherent, soldiers became panic-stricken and Tadamitsu completely lost popularity.

sen.j: 脱退する者も出始め天誅組の士気は低下する。
sen.e: Soldiers who withdrew from Tenchu-gumi began to appear, and the morale of Tenchu-gumi went down.
Those who withdrew from Tenchu-gumi began to appear, and the morale of Tenchu-gumi went down.
Those who withdrew from Tenchu-gumi began to appear, and the morale of Tenchu-gumi went down.

sen.j: 14日、紀州・津の藩兵が吉村寅太郎らの守る天の辻を攻撃、吉村は天の辻を放棄した。
sen.e: On 14th, soldiers of Kishu Domain and Tsu Domain attacked Ten no Tsuji that was defended by Torataro YOSHIMURA; YOSHIMURA abandoned Ten no Tsuji.
On October 26, soldiers of Kishu Domain and Tsu Domain attacked Ten no Tsuji that was defended by Torataro YOSHIMURA, leading him to abandon Ten no Tsuji.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: On October 26, soldiers of Kishu Domain and Tsu Domain attacked Ten no Tsuji that was defended by Torataro YOSHIMURA, leading him to abandon Ten no Tsuji.

sen.j: 中山忠光は天険を頼りに決戦しようとするが、朝廷は十津川村に忠光を逆賊とする令旨を下し、十津川郷士は変心して忠光らに退去を要求する。
sen.e: Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA was going to fight a decisive battle relying on a mountain fortress, but the Imperial Court gave Her Majesty's address to assume Tadamitsu an insurgent to Totsukawa village; samurai in Totsukawa Village changed their mind, and called for withdrawal to Tadamitsu.

Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA was going to fight a decisive battle relying on a mountain fortress, but the Imperial Court gave an Imperial address to Totsukawa Village declaring Tadamitsu as an insurgent; samurai in Totsukawa Village changed their mind, and called for withdrawal to Tadamitsu.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA was going to fight a decisive battle relying on a mountain fortress, but the Imperial Court gave an Imperial address to Totsukawa Village declaring Tadamitsu as an insurgent; samurai in Totsukawa Village changed their mind, and called for withdrawal to Tadamitsu.

sen.j: 19日、進退窮まった忠光は遂に天誅組の解散を命じた。
sen.e: Finally Tadamitsu, who was at a loss, commanded to dissolute Tenchu-gumi on 19th.
Finally Tadamitsu, who was at a loss, commanded the dissolution of Tenchu-gumi on October 31.
sen.cmt: 表現を一部変更しました。
sen.e: Finally Tadamitsu, who was at a loss, commanded the dissolution of Tenchu-gumi on October 31.

sen.j: 天誅組の残党は山中の難路を歩いて脱出をこころみるが、重傷を負っていた吉村寅太郎は一行から落伍してしまう。
sen.e: Remnants of Tenchu-gumi walked a rough road in the mountain and tried to escape, but the Torataro YOSHIMURA, who bore a serious wound dropped out of the party.
Remnants of Tenchu-gumi walked a rough road in the mountain and tried to escape, but Torataro YOSHIMURA, who bore a serious wound, dropped out of the party.
Remnants of Tenchu-gumi walked a rough road in the mountain and tried to escape, but Torataro YOSHIMURA, who bore a serious wound, dropped out of the party.

sen.j: 24日、一行は鷲尾峠を経た鷲家口（奈良県東吉野村）で紀州・彦根藩兵と遭遇。
sen.e: On 24th, at Washiyaguchi (Higashiyoshino Village, Nara Prefecture) which is located next to Washio Mountain Pass, the party met the soldiers from Kishu Domain and Hikone Domain.
On November 5, at Washiyaguchi (Higashiyoshino Village, Nara Prefecture) which is located next to Washio Mountain Pass, the party met the soldiers from Kishu Domain and Hikone Domain.

sen.e: On November 5, at Washiyaguchi (Higashiyoshino Village, Nara Prefecture) which is located next to Washio Mountain Pass, the party met the soldiers from Kishu Domain and Hikone Domain.

sen.j: 那須信吾は中山忠光を逃すべく決死隊を編成して敵陣に突入して討ち死に、藤本鉄石も討ち死にし、負傷して失明していた松本奎堂は自刃した。
sen.e: Shingo NASU organized a death squad in order to make Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA flee and entered into an enemy camp, and died in battle; Tesseki FUJIMOTO also die in battle; Keido MATSUMOTO who lost eye sight from an injury committed suicide.

Shingo NASU organized a death squad in order to make Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA flee, entered into an enemy camp and died in battle; Tesseki FUJIMOTO was also killed in battle; Keido MATSUMOTO who had lost eye sight from an injury committed suicide.

sen.j: 一行から遅れていた吉村寅太郎は27日に鷲家谷で津藩兵に撃たれて戦死。
sen.e: Torataro YOSHIMURA who was behind the party was shot at Washiyadani on 27th by a soldier of Tsu Domain and died.
Torataro YOSHIMURA who was behind the party was shot to death at Washiyadani on November 8 by a soldier of Tsu Domain.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: Torataro YOSHIMURA who was behind the party was shot to death at Washiyadani on November 8 by a soldier of Tsu Domain.

sen.j: 天誅組は壊滅した。
sen.e: Tenchu-gumi was destroyed.
Tenchu-gumi was destroyed.
Tenchu-gumi was destroyed.

sen.j: 中山忠光は辛くも敵の重囲をかいくぐり脱出に成功、27日に大坂に到着して長州藩邸に匿われた。
sen.e: Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA was closely besieged by enemy; he had a narrow escape and arrived at Osaka; soon after he was sheltered in Choshu Domain's house.
Tadamitsu NAKAYAMA had a narrow escape from enemy's heavy siege and arrived at Osaka on November 8; soon after he was sheltered in a residence of Choshu Domain.

sen.j: 忠光は長州に逃れて下関市に隠れていたが、禁門の変の後に長州藩の実権を握った恭順派（俗論党）によって元治元年（1864年）11月に絞殺された。
sen.e: Tadamitsu escaped to Choshu and was hiding himself in Shimonoseki City, but he was strangled in November of 1864 by a person who belonged to the deference faction (Zokuron-to) which came to have a real power after the Kinmon Incident.

He escaped to Choshu and was hiding himself in Shimonoseki City, but he was strangled in November of 1864 by the deference faction (Zokuron-to) which came to have the actual power within the domain after the Kinmon Incident.

sen.j: 事件の後の文久3年(1863年)10月に平野国臣が但馬国生野町で代官所を襲撃して挙兵。
sen.e: After the incident Kuniomi HIRANO attacked the magistrate's office in Ikuno-cho in Tajima Province in October of 1863 and raise an army.
After the incident, Kuniomi HIRANO attacked the magistrate's office in Ikuno-cho in Tajima Province in November 1863 and raised an army.

sen.j: 幕府軍の追討を受けて敗北している。
sen.e: His army was hunted down by the Shogunate force and he was defeated.
His army was hunted down by the bakufu army and was defeated.
His army was hunted down by the bakufu army and was defeated.

sen.e: Tenchu-gumi's uprising failed, but this incident became a fuse of the Meiji Restoration; therefore, this point is highly evaluated.
